name: MDSQuestionTagGenomics
title: MDS Question Tag Genomics
description: A set of codes used to map MDS Dataset to FHIR Resources.This is intended to be used on Resource.meta.tag.

concept.definition: Data group - Healthcare professional
HCP's function within the genomic test ordering process
HCP's first name.
HCP'surname
HCP's job title.
HCP's current specialty.
HCP's telephone number.
HCP's email address.
HCP's requesting organisation name.
HCP's organisation ODS code
HCP's department name.
HCP's professional registration number such as their GMC number.
HCP's professional registration number type such as 'GMC'.
Data group - Patient
Patient's title.
Patient's first name.
Patient's middle name.
Patient's last name.
Links each patient name entry to confirm if current, previous or what the patient is known as.
Patient's date of birth.
Patient's home postcode.
Patient's home country.
Patient's ethnicity.
Patient's phenotypic sex classification as defined at birth based on physical characteristic.
Patient's GP practice ODS code.
The fact of the patient's biological parents being descended from the same ancestor.
Patient's NHS number.
Patient's identification code other than NHS number.

concept.display: Patient - ODS code of organisation which assigned local identifier
concept.definition: ODS code of the organisation which assigned the local identifier P-16.

concept.display: Patient - Reason for unavailable NHS number
concept.definition: Reason for an NHS number not being provided.
This patient's relationship to the primary patient.
Patient's stated gender, determined by the patient.
Patient's date of death.
Patient's genomic / karyotypic characteristic. Determined by genomic testing.
Confirmation why the patient is withholding identity details.
Patient's pedigree or family identifying id.

concept.display: Patient - Reason for inclusion in genomic test request
concept.definition: Reason patient has been included in genomic test request, such as to support proband testing or providing own genomic reporting
Data group - Fetus
Fetus' identification code other than NHS number.

concept.display: Fetus - ODS code of organisation which assigned local identifier
concept.definition: ODS code of the organisation which assigned the local identifier F-1.
Fetus' phenotypic sex classification. Estimated physical characteristic. Currently determined by ultrasound. Gender for PLCM.
Fetus' genomic / karyotypic characteristic. Determined by genomic testing.

concept.display: Fetus - Life status at time of request
concept.definition: Fetus' alive or deceased status details at the point of test ordering.
The id of a given pregnancy which this fetus belongs to.
Data group - Test Request
How the test request is funded

concept.display: Test Request - Requesting reason rare disease
concept.definition: The reason for a rare disease genomic test.
The reason for a cancer genomic test.

concept.display: Test Request - High level test identifier
concept.definition: Legacy high level ids which identify the requested test. Options provided by old Test Directory.

concept.display: Test Request - High level test identifier description
concept.definition: Legacy high level name of the id requested

concept.display: Test Request - Low level test identifier
concept.definition: The low level CITT code which identifies the requested test. Options provided by Test Directory (TEST IDENTIFIER OR TEST CODE).

concept.display: Test Request - Low level test identifier description
concept.definition: The low level CITT name of the considered test.

concept.display: Test Request - Low level multipurpose test identifier
concept.definition: The low level code which identifies the test to be actioned when the CITT code is multipurpose (CLINICAL INDICATION).

concept.display: Test Request - Low level multipurpose test identifier description
concept.definition: The low level name of the test to be actioned when the CITT code is multipurpose.
Id of the package requested.
Name of the package requested.
Version of the package requested.
Id of the test requested.
Name of the test requested.
Version of the test requested.
Additional panels to test.
Type of target to test.
Detail of target to test.

concept.display: Test Request - Count of patients to be tested
concept.definition: Count of patients to be tested including the proband/primary patient.
The test request urgency reason.
The reason reanalysis has been requested.

concept.display: Test Request - Detail of reason for request
concept.definition: Further detail associated to the reason reanalysis has been requested.
The type of reanalysis which has been requested.
Confirmation if the test request is urgent.
The reason a given test request has been linked to another test request.

concept.display: Test Request - Central email address for reporting
concept.definition: Central email address for contingency in the event of not being able to obtain a report via the requester.

concept.display: Test Request - Genomic report delivery method
concept.definition: Test Request - Genomic report delivery method

concept.display: Test Request - Add private genomic request and report to NHS record
concept.definition: Confirmation if the content of a private genomic test request should be added to an NHS record.

concept.display: Test Request - Test request form version
concept.definition: Version of the test order form completed and submitted.

concept.display: Test Request - File / Link to file
concept.definition: Upload of a file or a link to a file for adding documents such as previous genomic reports to a test order.
Detail to provide context to an uploaded file or document link.
Clinical benefit to patient of obtaining a requested genomic report.

concept.display: Test Request - Linked test request reference
concept.definition: The reference to any associated test requests
Data group - NGRL consent

concept.display: NGRL consent - Date of NGRL consent
concept.definition: The date NGRL consent was provided.

concept.display: NGRL consent - Patient has made their own choice to consent to the NGRL
concept.definition: Confirmation if the patient to be tested has provided NGRL consent themselves.

concept.display: NGRL consent - Patient representative name (if patient cannot make their own choice)
concept.definition: The name of the patient representative.

concept.display: NGRL consent - I confirm that the patient (or their representative) agree to have their genomic and healthcare data used for research
concept.definition: The outcome of the patient or their representative’s choice in consenting to including their data used for research in the NGRL.

concept.display: NGRL consent - NGRL consent document link
concept.definition: A URL where a copy of a completed NGRL consent form may be found.
Data group - Primary Sample
Local ids applied to a sample

concept.display: Primary Sample - ODS code of organisation which assigned local id
concept.definition: ODS code of the organisation which assigned the local sample id.
Date at which a specimen/biopsy was obtained from patient.
The primary sample material.
The state of the primary sample.
How the primary sample is preserved.
Sample block identifier
Sample fixative type
Sample hours to fixation
Sample hours in fixative
Method used for tumour enrichment.
% necrotic (dead) cells in primary sample.
Nucleated (with nucleous) cell (non tumour and tumour) count in the primary sample  (Solid Tumour and Haem-Onc).

concept.display: Primary Sample - Tumour nuclear content in whole section
concept.definition: Neoplastic (tumour) cell content in the primary sample whole section(Solid Tumour) - sourced at local lab. (%)

concept.display: Primary Sample - Tumour nuclear content in marked area
concept.definition: Neoplastic (tumour) cell content in the primary sample marked area(Solid Tumour) - sourced at local lab. (%)
The histology and likely course of development of a tumour.
The tumour sample site. e.g. from colon, stomach etc.
Primary Sample - Is biopsy
Digital confirmation that the sample is a biopsy.

concept.display: Primary Sample - Observed maternal cell contamination (MCC)
concept.definition: An observed outcome which may indicate MCC

concept.display: Primary Sample - Test confirmed maternal cell contamination (MCC)
concept.definition: Analytically confirmed MCC levels

concept.display: Primary Sample - Option for all products of conception
concept.definition: Primary Sample - Option for all products of conception
Future management for products of conception.

concept.display: Primary Sample - High infection risk reason
concept.definition: The high contamination risk reason for a primary sample.

concept.display: Primary Sample - Patient life status at the time of collection
concept.definition: If the patient was alive or deceased at the point of collecting a sample.
The origin or context of a tumour sample.
Data group - Patient Clinical Information
Patient's ethnicity where 'Patient - Ethnicity field' doesn't provide an adequate description. E.g Ashkenazi Jewish
If the patient is affected, unaffected, or it is unknown.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Age at disease onset
concept.definition: The age when a change in patients' health was first noted in line with suspected diagnosis.
Disease a patient is believed, known to have, or be at risk of developing.
The HPO (or alternative ontology as appropriate) term names for the observable disease traits.
The patient's symptoms

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Count of tumours
concept.definition: How many tumours the patient has.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Site of tumour
concept.definition: Location of the tumours on the body.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Tumour sites - Body image diagram
concept.definition: Image attachment of body with tumour sites highlighted.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Pedigree details / Relevant family history
concept.definition: The patient's pedigree/family history details (inc family history of cancer).
Image attachment of pedigree details

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Laterality of hearing loss
concept.definition: Laterality of the hearing loss i.e. bilateral or unilateral.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Fetal haemoglobinopathy maternal screening genotype
concept.definition: Maternal screening genotype for haemoglobinopathy testing.
Legal considerations for a given request.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Fetal haemoglobinopathy paternal screening genotype
concept.definition: Paternal screening genotype for haemoglobinopathy testing

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Expected Maternity Unit - Organisation name
concept.definition: Requesting clinician's organisation name.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Expected Maternity Unit - Organisation address
concept.definition: Requesting clinician's organisation address.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Expected Maternity Unit - Organisation ODS code
concept.definition: Requesting clinician's organisation ODS code.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Expected Maternity Unit - Department name
concept.definition: Requesting clinician's department name.
Summary passage of text to highlight patient centile history e.g. head circumference, weight, etc.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Severity of hearing loss
concept.definition: Free text regarding hearing loss
Free text regarding retinal degeneration
Toxic medication - Prematurity (risk factor for hearing loss) e.g. Baby early birth - Ototoxic medication.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Suspected inborn error type(s)
concept.definition: Suspected inborn error type(s)

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Abnormal infection history site
concept.definition: Abnormal infection history site organism

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Abnormal infection history site organism
concept.definition: Abnormal infection history site organism
If the patient is on immunoglobin replacement treatment.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Current and previous treatment detail
concept.definition: Detail regarding relevant current and previous medical treatments.
Patient`s pregnancy status
Type of conception

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Pregnancy gestation period
concept.definition: Patient's term of active pregnancy at point of test request.
Stage during patient pregnancy at which it terminated.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Estimated delivery date (EDD)
concept.definition: Patient's estimated delivery date.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - IVF age of egg donor
concept.definition: The age of the patient who donated the egg at the time of donation.
Has the patient ever had a transplant.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Type of transplant
concept.definition: What type of transplant the patient had.
When the patient had the transplant.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Had transfusion in the last 6 weeks
concept.definition: Has the patient had a transfusion in the last 6 weeks.

concept.display: Patient clinical information - Type of transfusion
concept.definition: What type of transfusion the patient has had.
When the patient had the transfusion.
Patient's height.
Data group - Miscellaneous
Supporting information which has not been captured elsewhere.
Data group - Hospital encounter
The identifier for the clinical specialty or service under which the patient is being treated.
The identifier for the patient's continuous period of care in a hospital provider setting, from admission to discharge.
The identifier for the patient's specific outpatient appointment at which the genomic test may have been ordered.
The identifier that defines the type of care setting in which the genomic test was requested.
